Description: An open bangle: composed of two gold wires looped together in the centre to form a reef knot. The break in the wire shows that a flattened hollow cavity is present in the centre. Two seams are visible on the surface.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found on wrist of a female
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: bracelet with amulet (1929,1015.469). girdles (1929,1015.470 & 1929,1015.471 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklaces (1929,1015.474 & 1929,1015.475). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2, no; pl.LXVII, 3; Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; The British Museum, 'Jewellery through 7000 years' [exhibition catalogue] (London, 1976), no. 18. G. Pinch, Magic in Ancient Egypt (London 1994), fig.41.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (276)
